div.p: Nine representative bird species of the study area. From left to right, and top to bottom: Carduelis carduelis, Sylvia undata, Parus major, Turdus viscivorus, Sylvia melanocephala, Emberiza cia, Lophophanes cristatus, Aegithalos caudatus, and Loxia curvirostra. Photograph credit: Carlos Gonz√°lez Revelles
